page.syntax: OutputString as C = TEXT(C text,N XPos,N YPos[,C text_alignment])

argument.name: text
argument.description: The text to draw on the bitmap.

argument.name: XPos
argument.description: The horizontal coordinate of the bitmap to use for alignment.

argument.name: YPos
argument.description: The vertical coordinate of the bitmap to use for alignment.

argument.name: text_alignment
argument.description: Optional. Default = "top-left". The point on the text to use for alignment. Possible values include one argument in the format "argument" or combinations of two arguments in the format "first_argument-second_argument".

item.name: You may also use: "rotate" when you use a True Type font. See SET_ROTATE()-

page.description: Draw text using the current font.
page.discussion: TEXT() draws the indicated Text at the specified coordinates. Limitations: Used only in the Code sections of UI_BITMAP_DRAW(), UI_SCREEN_DRAW(), and UI_PRINTER_DRAW().

section.title: Example
section.description: The following example displays the text "Sample" centered vertically and horizontally on the bitmap.
section.example: ui_bitmap_create("test", 4, 1) ui_bitmap_draw("test",<<%code% set_font("Verdana,20,biu", "blue", "white") inner_Rect(0, 0, 4, 1) text("Sample", bitmap_width("test")/2, bitmap_height("test")/2, "center") %code%) ui_dlg_box("","{image=test}")
